title: 106_hr5469
content: The Act titled "Integrity of the United States Courts Act of 2000" allows for judicial review of binational panel decisions under the North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act. The "Integrity of the United States Courts Act of 2000" allows for judicial review of binational panel decisions under the North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act within 30 days after publication in the Federal Register. If a party alleges misconduct, bias, departure from procedure, or exceeding of powers by the panel that materially affected the decision, they can file an appeal with the United States Court of International Trade. If a party alleges misconduct, bias, departure from procedure, or exceeding of powers by the panel that materially affected the decision, they can file an appeal with the United States Court of International Trade for review of the binational panel determination under the Tariff Act of 1930. The Court of International Trade will examine the legal and factual analysis of the panel's decision and determine if any actions described have been established. The court's decisions are binding on the parties involved. The Court of International Trade decisions are binding on parties regarding matters before the panel. Exclusive jurisdiction resides with the Court if a notice of appeal is filed. This section applies to goods from NAFTA countries subject to antidumping or countervailing duty determinations. The Court of International Trade has exclusive jurisdiction over appeals related to binational panel determinations. Section 516A of the Tariff Act of 1930 is amended to include provisions related to binational panel determinations under NAFTA. The Court of International Trade has exclusive jurisdiction over appeals regarding these determinations. Section 516A of the Tariff Act of 1930 is amended to include provisions for binational panel determinations under NAFTA, with the Court of International Trade having exclusive jurisdiction over appeals. Additionally, a new provision is added for parties or persons to request review under section 404A of the North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act. The amendments made by this Act will apply to final determinations of binational panels under NAFTA published in the Federal Register after the enactment date of this Act.
